title: Laptop for no more than $500
body: Hey guys I'm in college now and I need a new laptop that will be able to run league of legends well that fits my budget, $500.

replies.body: Same {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}} I'm getting a new laptop as well. Google this and click on the Amazon website one. 2016 Newest ASUS Premium High Performance 15.6" HD Flagship Laptop Intel i5-5200u Dual-Core Processor 6GB RAM 1T HDD DVD-RW HDMI WIFI WEBCAM Bluetooth Windows 10- Black
If you get it soon could you tell me how well it is between school and League?
Sure, it's going to be my next paycheck though, two weeks about.

my laptop is just around $350 and runs league just fine. League is made to be able to run even on lower end PCs

to prove the point, I could run league on lowest settings on my previous laptop (rest its poor soul) that had 2 gigs ram, an old AMD turion 64x2 processor and was bought on 2008 if I remember correctly or 2007.
What laptop is it, and do you run at least Skype and league legends at once? (I want to know so that if I do get it I know I can play and communicate to my team or friends without a problem)

> [{quoted}](name=Eclipsed Ziex,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=EHQb42I8,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-09-26T22:29:35.806+0000)
>
> What laptop is it, and do you run at least Skype and league legends at once? (I want to know so that if I do get it I know I can play and communicate to my team or friends without a problem)

yeah I almost always have skype running.

it's a dell inspiron  15,  3000 series, model 3521.
black matte with textured finish.
of course with the $500 you could get something a bit better than mine, it never hurts to have a little extra performance under the hood.

though my biggest recommendation at the moment would be to possibly look for something that does NOT have windows 10 installed because of all the weird issues it has running league sometimes. That or if you have another version of windows (7 or 8) to install on it, then that would be good as well since it wont matter if u get windows 10 pre-installed then. I'm running Win 8.1,  i3-3227U cpu 2 core 1.9GHz,  6gig ram, intel HD graphics, 64bit. about 2.5 hour battery life.

normally would have gotten something a bit better but there was an accident and my old laptop didn't work any more and I needed my laptop for work so I went to the nearest stores to look for a new one the same day and found this one to be good for the price. Normally I wanted to buy a gaming laptop aside from my old one but didn't have much cash at that time so I wanted to avoid a BIG purchase of closer to the $800 - $1000 I had been originally planning to spend on a performance laptop. This one has been working perfectly fine and no real complaints about it

Hey, congrats on starting college! ^.^

While I can't suggest specific laptop models, I think a good place to start is by ensuring any prospects meet our [Optimal Hardware Suggestions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements/#wq3). Be sure to read the reviews and ensure your model has rated well in decent cooling and reliability. Also, consider battery life ratings. All of those factors are pretty important to a college student in my experience. 

Let me know if you have any questions!
Thank you a lot, I've looked at the specs and I'll be sure to get something along those lines.

Does it HAVE to be a laptop? Cause if not i can hop on pcpartpicker.com piece something together for you... and link you a youtube video of how to put it together. My home machine was 500 bucks it runs league uncapped at 250 FPS
G3258 Pentium Processor (anniversary edition)
4GB RAM 1333mhz
GTX 760ti GPU
blah blah blah rest doesnt matter much
Sadly it has to be a laptop because I tend to go to my friends house and game there as well as study, thank you though.
